First of all, thanks a ton for all the feedback everyone – I think I have most of my Sunday filled now. '^^

<@U67431ELR>, I will read through the Fedora spec and patches; I am likely to take you up on that offer for a discussion later on as well because I sure intend to make a 1.6-rc Nix expression to run it on PkgEvalNix – not to mention that I will need to push it into Nixpkgs at some point.

<@U680THK2S>, to me it really depends on how “bad” we look as a project if we have two releases on our download page with CVEs attached to them. I have not dug into the exact nature of the exploits, but at least superficially it does sound like you could create a Julia package that if cloned could execute code remotely – then again, you are downloading third-party code, so, um, are you not already doing exactly that? ;P

One larger question that would really help to have clarity regarding right now is to what extent one should balance using Julia’s vendored dependencies with those from the system package manager. LLVM for example is a no-brainer, but what else? I realise the risk in asking this as I suspect plenty of you would prefer to vendor everything. '^^

, to me it really depends on how “bad” we look as a project if we have two releases on our download page with CVEs attached to them. One larger question that would really help to have clarity regarding right now is to what extent one should balance using Julia’s vendored dependencies with those from the system package manager. LLVM for example is a no-brainer, but what else? I realise the risk in asking this as I suspect plenty of you would prefer to vendor everything. '^^

My current portion on vendoring:

```    # The Julia project vendors its dependencies and not-yet-upstreamed patches
    # are common, thus we opt to preserve some key vendored dependencies.
    "USE_SYSTEM_LLVM=0"
    "USE_SYSTEM_LIBUV=0"
    # Libraries created/maintained by the Julia project, allow vendoring.
    "USE_SYSTEM_LIBM=0"
    "USE_SYSTEM_OPENLIBM=0"
    "USE_SYSTEM_UTF8PROC=0"
    # Currently missing in Nixpkgs, allow vendoring for now.
    "USE_SYSTEM_DSFMT=0"
    "USE_SYSTEM_SUITESPARSE=0"```
